event.desc: The birth of Alice Osborne, AT's mother.

event.desc: AT was made ill by undercooked beef

event.desc: AT fell from a dangerously driven coach

event.desc: AT experienced a spiritual awakening on her 12th birthday

event.desc: There was a fire at Dublin Castle

event.desc: AT and her mother went to England for her mother to be treated for "the Stone"

event.desc: AT almost fell overboard in the storm and was rescued by a seaman

event.label: dream

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford predicted bad times were coming but he wouldn't live to see them
event.label: prophecy

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford rescued the child Frank Kelly to bring up with the household
event.label: family

event.desc: The Earl of Strafford was recalled to England amid plots resulting in his execution
event.label: conflict

event.desc: AT had a dream of her father's death
event.label: dream

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford became ill after going to church
event.label: illness

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford made preparations for death
event.label: illness

event.label: medical

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford predicted bad things were coming (especially?) for AT

event.desc: The deathbed and death of Christopher Wandesford
event.label: death

event.desc: The funeral of Christopher Wandesford
event.label: burial

event.desc: Brother Christopher Wandesford fell ill at their father's funeral
event.label: illness

event.desc: Debts were incurred after Christopher Wandesford's death
event.label: money

event.desc: Rebellion began in Ireland outside Dublin
event.label: conflict

event.desc: Dublin was saved from the plot
event.label: conflict

event.desc: The Wandesfords escaped from Ireland to Chester
event.label: conflict

event.desc: Cousin William Wandesford ignored Alice Wandesford's advice to leave Castlecomer
event.label: conflict

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford made his final will
event.label: legal

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford's will was publicly read and witnessed
event.label: legal

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford’s will was proved before the rebellion
event.label: legal

event.desc: George Wandesford obtained an official copy of the will in Ireland
event.label: legal

event.desc: The Wandesford siblings copied out their father's will
event.label: legal

event.desc: Sir John Lowther tried to persuade George Wandesford to overturn his father's will
event.label: legal

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford claimed to have lost the official copy of his father's will
event.label: legal

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford began law suits to overturn the will, at Lowther's instigation
event.label: legal

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford made searches for the will in Ireland and it could no longer be found
event.label: legal

event.desc: William Thornton started another search for the will in Ireland.
event.label: legal

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford’s will was found in Ireland
event.label: legal

event.desc: Mother sent George to England to stay with uncle Osborne for his education
event.label: education

event.desc: George Wandesford was sent to France for his education until he had to return to England for 'lack of supplies'
event.label: education

event.desc: John Wandesford caught smallpox; AT sent him messages via a pet dog
event.label: illness

event.desc: Frank Kelly caught smallpox and died
event.label: death

event.desc: AT caught smallpox from the dog
event.label: illness

event.desc: AT recovered and received the sacrament
event.label: religion

event.desc: Uncle William Wandesford asked for the Book of Advice and it was lost in the wars
event.label: family

event.desc: The Book of Advice was found again
event.label: family

event.desc: Sister Katherine Danby gave birth to a son named Charles
event.label: childbirth

event.desc: Sir William Brereton's army attacked Chester's defences for two days
event.label: conflict

event.desc: AT was nearly shot by a cannon ball during the attack
event.label: danger

event.desc: The Wandesford family travelled from Chester to Downham, via Warrington and Wigan.
event.label: conflict

event.desc: AT fell sick at Richmond after eating lobster
event.label: illness

event.desc: After AT recovered, the family went on to Snape where they stayed for several months
event.label: conflict

event.desc: The family went to live at Kirklington while Hipswell was made habitable
event.label: family

event.desc: The family finally arrived at Hipswell, where they were troubled by Scottish soldiers
event.label: conflict

event.desc: Christopher Wandesford was sent to Dr Bathurst at York for a cure for 'fits of the spleen'
event.label: medical

event.desc: John Wandesford's education at Cambridge
event.label: education

event.desc: John Wandesford became depressed after denial of inheritance
event.label: illness

event.desc: John Wandesford was sent to Dr Bathurst for a cure
event.label: medical

event.desc: Alice Wandesford and AT began to travel to York but were turned back by Thomas Danby and went to Kirklington
event.label: conflict

event.desc: The Royalist armies were defeated at the battle of Marston Moor
event.label: conflict

event.desc: George Wandesford was also near Marston Moor, rescued Christopher and took him to Kirklington
event.label: conflict

event.desc: Scottish soldiers searched at Kirklington the day after Marston Moor and George Wandesford had to flee into the Dales
event.label: conflict

event.desc: After the battle at Marston Moor the Scots army was quartered all over the country
event.label: conflict

event.desc: AT was almost drowned while crossing the river near Middleham
event.label: accident

event.desc: At Hipswell, the family were saved from plague at Richmond.
event.label: illness

event.desc: The death of Mr Daggett, minister of Kirklington
event.label: death

event.desc: The Wandesfords tried to present Mr Siddall with the living
event.label: war/politics

event.desc: Parliament refused and appointed an ignorant blasphemer who was booed out of the church
event.label: war/politics

event.desc: Siddall turned to Mr Nesbitt and Alderman Hoyle for help
event.label: war/politics

event.desc: Nesbitt betrayed Siddall to get the living for himself and Mr Siddall was sequestered for not giving it up
event.label: war/politics

event.desc: Alderman Hoyle committed suicide a year after the regicide
event.label: death

event.desc: Nesbitt got George Wandesford sequestered so he could have the Kirklington living
event.label: war/politics

event.desc: Enemies tried to get soldiers to swear falsely that they saw George Wandesford fight at Marston Moor.
event.label: war/politics

event.desc: George Wandesford's estates were sequestered, and he was forced to flee and hide
event.label: war/politics

event.desc: George Wandesford's sequestration was lifted with help from Richard Darley
event.label: legal

event.desc: AT was saved from rape by Captain Innes at Hipswell
event.label: danger

event.desc: AT was saved from being raped by Jeremy Smithson
event.label: danger

event.desc: Thomas Danby of Cave was killed at Naseby
event.label: death

event.desc: AT had a dream of her sister Katherine Danby's death in childbed
event.label: dream

event.desc: Katherine Danby gave birth to her sixteenth child
event.label: childbirth

event.label: illness

event.desc: AT's grief made her so ill she had to be sent home
event.label: illness

event.label: death

event.label: burial

event.desc: AT almost drowned near St Nicholas
event.label: accident

event.label: religion

event.desc: George Wandesford impressed Mrs Darcy with his bible reading
event.label: religion

event.desc: George Wandesford visited Hipswell on Easter Monday to consult mother about writing to Darley; AT had a pain in the neck
event.label: family

event.desc: George Wandesford drowned on Easter Monday while crossing the river in a hurry to write a letter

event.label: marriage

event.label: marriage

event.label: medical

event.desc: Marriage to William Thornton was proposed by Uncle William Wandesford and Darley to save the family
event.label: marriage

event.desc: Alice Wandesford agreed to the proposal and encouraged AT to accept
event.label: marriage

event.desc: AT was reluctant to marry but was persuaded
event.label: marriage

event.desc: William Thornton and Alice Wandesford entered into negotiations and agreed a settlement
event.label: marriage

event.desc: William Thornton became ill because of his father-in-law's refusal to consent
event.label: illness

event.desc: The marriage of AT and William Thornton
event.label: marriage

event.desc: AT fell sick on her wedding day
event.label: illness

event.desc: AT and William Thornton lived at Hipswell with Alice Wandesford until her death
event.label: family

event.desc: AT became pregnant soon after the marriage and suffered sickness and nosebleeds
event.label: pregnancy

event.desc: AT observed an eclipse of the sun during her first pregnancy
event.label: natural

event.desc: AT travelled to visit William Thornton's family while heavily pregnant and endured a dangerous journey home.
event.label: travel

event.desc: AT became severely ill after returning to hipswell
event.label: illness

event.desc: AT gave birth to her first child, which lived for only minutes
event.label: childbirth

event.desc: The death and burial of AT's first child
event.label: death

event.desc: AT suffered postpartum illness which lasted several months
event.label: illness

event.desc: AT helped Anne Danby and family when they were ill treated by the Danbys
event.label: family

event.desc: William Thornton was persuaded by Darley and William Wandesford, to take over the Wandesford estate in Ireland, against advice of Alice Wandesford and AT.
event.label: legal

event.desc: William Thornton became liable for debts owed to the Irish estates, leading to selling property set aside for children in the marriage settlement
event.label: legal

event.desc: Sir John Lowther offered AT's mother a deal for her loss of income from Irish estates, but Darley advised against it
event.label: money

event.desc: AT agreed to give up Burn Park on condition that a new settlement for the children would be drawn up
event.label: legal

event.desc: AT and her mother gave evidence in Chancery suit with Nettleton about Christopher Wandesford's will
event.label: legal

event.desc: Nettleton's bailiffs came to Newton roughly demanding money
event.label: money

event.desc: William Thornton gave up the Irish estate as part of a legal deal with Christopher Wandesford
event.label: legal

event.desc: AT advised William Thornton to use money from the Wandesford deal for his siblings' portions but he refused
event.label: legal

event.desc: AT became aware of pregnancy with her second child
event.label: pregnancy

event.label: childbirth

event.label: baptism

event.desc: AT was ill after Nally's birth and unable to breastfeed
event.label: illness

event.label: childbirth

event.label: illness

event.desc: AT recovered and breastfeed Elizabeth for a fortnight but a new Nally crisis
event.label: breastfeeding

event.desc: Nally was cutting teeth which caused her fits

event.desc: AT's mother made her stop breastfeeding Elizabeth
event.label: breastfeeding

event.desc: Daphne wetnursed Elizabeth for a while but then put out to nurse
event.label: breastfeeding

event.label: danger

event.label: pregnancy

event.desc: AT gave birth to her first son, who died shortly after birth

event.desc: AT was forced by Christopher to sign over her rights in her father's will

event.desc: AT started to recover from illness after husband's death

event.label: religion

event.desc: A chicken pecked AT in the eye while she was writing
event.label: metaphors

event.desc: AT received the sacrament at Easter
event.label: religion

event.desc: The death of AT's brother Christopher
event.label: death

event.desc: Abstrupus Danby broke his promise to compensate AT for her costs relieving the Danbys
event.label: family
